meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inclined to steal or commit theft.
meanings.sent1: Her thievishnesses were evident when she kept taking snacks without permission.
meanings.sent2: The detective noticed the thievishnesses of the suspect as he furtively looked around the room.
meanings.sent3: Despite his thievishnesses, he always had a charming smile that fooled many.
meanings.sent4: The thievishnesses of the raccoon were compared to those of a mischievous child.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley was filled with the thievishnesses of the night, lurking in every shadow.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors characteristic of a thief.
meanings.sent1: The security camera captured the thievishnesses of the burglar as he broke into the house.
meanings.sent2: His thievishnesses became more daring as he planned bigger heists.
meanings.sent3: The cat's thievishnesses were revealed when it tried to steal a piece of fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The thievishnesses of the pickpocket were as swift as a gust of wind.
meanings.sent5: The pirate's crew was known for their thievishnesses on the high seas.
